primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The restoration of a fallen soul through confession and divine healing to avoid the dual pitfalls of despair and presumption.

tekstueel_bewijs: Mount the tribunal of your conscience
Punish it yourself so as not to be punished for it
A pure heart create for me
To heal the wounds of sin
God looks away when he sees nothing; but when he does see something, he punishes it

ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is strongly identified with the Subject who must perform the act of confession.

tekstueel_bewijs: We need a doctor to restore our health
helper.rol_van_god: God is primarily the Helper/Doctor who responds to the Subject's initiative.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help requested by the soul.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Serpent/Satan and the Soul's own Despair/Presumption
tekstueel_bewijs: The devil is delighted when we accuse him
Perish if you despair, and perish if you hope
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Satan is a real tempter, but the internal psychological states of despair and presumption are the immediate lethal threats.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical management of one's life (choosing 'good' things like clothes/wife vs. a 'good' life).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical life is presented as the logical outcome of avoiding the 'sudden wrath' of the Sender.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God must come and restore it
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Mount the tribunal of your conscience
Reject the very first suggestion of sin

voorbeelden: We must take care not to sin
Since it must be punished, punish it yourself
Why not want it to be good?
I’ll share with you some insights
The poor wretch... can't heal himself
May God grant us two virtues... enabling us to control

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily weighted toward obligation (Devoir). While it acknowledges a lack of power (Pouvoir), the solution is the Subject's decision to use the 'Doctor' (God).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from S2 (threat of punishment) to ~S2 (refuting despair), then to ~S1 (refuting presumption), finally urging S1 (Confession).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the Subject's immediate action: 'Go and confess... lest you be condemned.'
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; God is depicted as a judge who must punish sin if the sinner does not.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses high 'grace' language and acknowledges human inability to self-heal, the underlying engine is synergistic and conditional. God is the 'Doctor,' but the patient must 'mount the tribunal.'

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: God averts his gaze from our sins when we confess them.
If you punish it, the sin will be punished, not you.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Though the poor wretch was able to wound himself, he can’t heal himself.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Psalmist is used as a model for the hearer's own performance of repentance.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on how God's faithfulness to the covenant forced David to repentance, rather than David's technique of self-accusation.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Anxiety regarding the timing of conversion and the adequacy of self-punishment.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Salvation is a cooperation where man provides the 'will' and God provides the 'medicine'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Doctor' metaphor to the 'Judge/Tribunal' metaphor creates a slight narrative clash between therapy and law.
spanning_punten: God as a Doctor who heals vs. God as a Judge who punishes if you don't punish yourself.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Sin can’t remain unpunished... punish it yourself so as not to be punished for it.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit/God grants the 'virtue' to control passions, but only after the soul 'begs for it with all my heart'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Lethal; sin is a wound that the soul can inflict but not cure.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon correctly identifies God as the source of healing but incorrectly positions the human 'confession' as the cause of God's 'looking away.'

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The sinner is the subject of 'punishing' and 'healing-initiation'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God the Subject of the search and the pursuit of the sinner.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'God looks away when we confess,' use 'God's kindness leads you to repentance.'

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Lost Sheep' being found.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the 'Son of Man came to seek' quote over the 'Mount the tribunal' command.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the Cross is the 'punishment' so the sinner doesn't have to 'punish himself'.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Satan and Sin are already treated as serious threats.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon's strength is its serious hamartology.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (living a good life) is used as a threat to induce conversion.
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God has forgiven you in Christ) → Ethics (Therefore, live a life worthy of this gift).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a strong grasp of human frailty but risks falling into a 'theology of the coffin' where the hearer is pressured by the fear of death rather than drawn by the beauty of Christ.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would praise the effective use of the 'clothes/wife' analogies; Greimas reveals these analogies actually shift the Subject to a consumer-choice model of salvation.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the meaning of 'pure heart' in Hebrew; Greimas shows how the sermon uses the verse as a 'mandate' for the Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes the 'Self-Punishment' logic as a structural replacement for the Atonement.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Semi-Pelagian' actantial structure: God provides the medicine, but the man must provide the 'willingness' to be a patient.
